meanings.definition: People who borrow something, especially money or items.
meanings.sent1: The borrowers returned the library books on time.
meanings.sent2: The borrowers asked to borrow some sugar from their neighbor.
meanings.sent3: The borrowers decided to borrow a ladder to reach the high shelf.
meanings.sent4: The borrowers were like little ants, carrying away their borrowed treasures.
meanings.sent5: The borrowers were known for their habit of borrowing tools from friends.

meanings.definition: The act of borrowing money or items.
meanings.sent1: The borrowers of the group pooled their money to buy a gift.
meanings.sent2: The borrowers always made sure to return what they borrowed promptly.
meanings.sent3: The borrowers found themselves in a funny situation when they forgot to return the borrowed umbrella.
meanings.sent4: The borrowers of the world create a web of exchanges that keep things moving.
meanings.sent5: The borrowers understood the importance of keeping track of what they borrowed.

meanings.definition: A book or movie series about tiny people who borrow things from humans.
meanings.sent1: The borrowers in the story had many adventures in the human world.
meanings.sent2: The borrowers movie was a favorite among children for its magical storyline.
meanings.sent3: The borrowers' tiny size led to comical situations when trying to borrow everyday items.
meanings.sent4: The borrowers' world was a miniature wonderland of borrowed treasures.
meanings.sent5: The borrowers' ability to borrow from humans made for an enchanting tale.
